required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 10, 2017
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Maternal Obesity on Labour Induction in Pastdate Pregnancy
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Maternal Obesity on Labour Induction in Pastdate Pregnancy

brief_summary.textblock: This study investigate the progression of labour in 459 normal weight pregnant women (BMI <30) and 459 obese pregnant women (BMI <30) , not in labor admitted for induction of labor. These women are to be investigated for success of induction of labor.

detailed_description.textblock:
- This prospective study will be conducted for 459 obese and 459 non obese ), post date (>41 wks), not in labor.
- Woman is classified as obese if BMI >=30.
- Prolonged pregnancy was defined as delivery on or after (41+0 weeks) of gestation.
- First informed consent will be obtained.
- Determination of gestational age
- Proper history taking, general and abdominal examinations will be done then digital examination will be performed to determine bishop score.
- And obstetric U/S scan will be done and by which the following data will be obtained :
- Fetal biometry
- Fetal heart activity
- Presentation
- Localization of the placenta.
- Amount of amniotic fluid.
- Exclude multifetal pregnancy.
- Induction of labor will be done using vaginal misoprostol according to the estimated Bishop score.

primary_outcome.measure: route of delivery vaginal or caesarean section.
primary_outcome.description: Partogram is used to access the progress of labour

intervention.description: misoprostol 25 microgran every 4-6 hours will be given to obese and non obese groups

study_pop.textblock: 459pregnant women with BMI >= 30 and 459 pregnant women with BMI <30, post date >= 41 wks, not in labor admitted in Kaselaini H for induction of labor.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant woman.
- Post date >= 41 weeks.
- Absent onset of labor.
- Patient acceptance to join the study after signing an informed consent.
Exclusion Criteria:
- â€¢ Malpresentation.
- Major degree of cephalopelvic disproportion.
- Placenta previa and or vasa previa.
- Previous CS.
- Multiple gestation.
- Indications of emergency CS.
- Any patient who will refuse to be a part of the study.
- IUFD.
